00006 namespace eval menus {
00007 
00008   variable profile_report  [file join $::tke_home profiling_report.log]
00009   variable show_split_pane 0
00010 
00011   array set profiling_info {}

00013   #######################
00014   #  PUBLIC PROCEDURES  #
00015   #######################
00016 
00017   ######################################################################
00018   # Returns the menu associated with the given menu path.  The menu path
00019   # should be a list where each menu item is the name of the menu within
00020   # the path.  The final menu in the path should not be included in the
00021   # path.
00022   proc get_menu {menu_path} {
00023 
00024     set parent .menubar
00025 
00026     foreach mnu $menu_path {
00027       if {([set mnu_index [$parent index [msgcat::mc $mnu]]] eq "none") || ([$parent type $mnu_index] ne "cascade")} {
00028         return -code error "Invalid menu path specified"
00029       }
00030       set parent [$parent entrycget $mnu_index -menu]
00031     }
00032 
00033     return $parent
00034 
00035   }
00036 
00037   ######################################################################
00038   # Invokes the given index in the given menu, executing the menu's postcommand
00039   # if one exists.
00040   proc invoke {mnu index} {
00041 
00042     # If the menu contains a postcommand, execute it first
00043     if {[$mnu cget -postcommand] ne ""} {
00044       eval [$mnu cget -postcommand]
00045     }
00046 
00047     # Next, invoke the menu
00048     $mnu invoke $index
00049 
00050   }
00051 
00052   ######################################################################
00053   # Creates the main menu.
00054   proc create {} {
00055 
00056     set foreground [utils::get_default_foreground]
00057     set background [utils::get_default_background]
00058 
00059     set mb [menu .menubar -foreground $foreground -background $background -relief flat -tearoff false]
00060 
00061     # Add the file menu
00062     $mb add cascade -label [msgcat::mc "File"] -menu [menu $mb.file -relief flat -tearoff false -postcommand "menus::file_posting $mb.file"]
00063     add_file $mb.file
00064 
00065     # Add the edit menu
00066     $mb add cascade -label [msgcat::mc "Edit"] -menu [menu $mb.edit -tearoff false -postcommand "menus::edit_posting $mb.edit"]
00067     add_edit $mb.edit
00068 
00069     # Add the find menu
00070     $mb add cascade -label [msgcat::mc "Find"] -menu [menu $mb.find -tearoff false -postcommand "menus::find_posting $mb.find"]
00071     add_find $mb.find
00072 
00073     # Add the text menu
00074     $mb add cascade -label [msgcat::mc "Text"] -menu [menu $mb.text -tearoff false -postcommand "menus::text_posting $mb.text"]
00075     add_text $mb.text
00076 
00077     # Add the view menu
00078     $mb add cascade -label [msgcat::mc "View"] -menu [menu $mb.view -tearoff false -postcommand "menus::view_posting $mb.view"]
00079     add_view $mb.view
00080 
00081     # Add the tools menu
00082     $mb add cascade -label [msgcat::mc "Tools"] -menu [menu $mb.tools -tearoff false -postcommand "menus::tools_posting $mb.tools"]
00083     add_tools $mb.tools
00084 
00085     # Add the plugins menu
00086     $mb add cascade -label [msgcat::mc "Plugins"] -menu [menu $mb.plugins -tearoff false]
00087     add_plugins $mb.plugins
00088 
00089     # Add the help menu
00090     $mb add cascade -label [msgcat::mc "Help"] -menu [menu $mb.help -tearoff false]
00091     add_help $mb.help
00092 
00093     # If we are running on Mac OS X, add the window menu with the windowlist package
00094     if {[tk windowingsystem] eq "aqua"} {
00095 
00096       # Add the window menu with the windowlist package
00097       windowlist::windowMenu $mb
00098       
00099       # Add the launcher command to show the about window
00100       launcher::register "Menus: About TKE" gui::show_about
00101       
00102     }
00103 
00104     if {([tk windowingsystem] eq "aqua") || $preferences::prefs(View/ShowMenubar)} {
00105       . configure -menu $mb
00106     }
00107 
00108     # Load and apply the menu bindings
00109     bindings::load
00110 
00111   }
00112 
00113   ######################################################################
00114   # Handles any changes to the General/WindowTheme preference variable.
00115   proc handle_window_theme {theme} {
00116 
00117     set foreground [utils::get_default_foreground]
00118     set background [utils::get_default_background]
00119 
00120     if {[winfo exists .menubar] && ([tk windowingsystem] ne "aqua")} {
00121       .menubar configure -foreground $foreground -background $background
00122     }
00123 
00124   }

00131   # Adds the file menu.
00132   proc add_file {mb} {
00133 
00134     $mb delete 0 end
00135 
00136     $mb add command -label [msgcat::mc "New"] -underline 0 -command "menus::new_command"
00137     launcher::register [msgcat::mc "Menu: New file"] menus::new_command
00138 
00139     $mb add command -label [msgcat::mc "Open File..."] -underline 0 -command "menus::open_command"
00140     launcher::register [msgcat::mc "Menu: Open file"] menus::open_command
00141 
00142     $mb add command -label [msgcat::mc "Open Directory..."] -underline 5 -command "menus::open_dir_command"
00143     launcher::register [msgcat::mc "Menu: Open directory"] menus::open_dir_command
00144 
00145     $mb add cascade -label [msgcat::mc "Open Recent"] -menu [menu $mb.recent -tearoff false -postcommand "menus::file_recent_posting $mb.recent"]
00146     launcher::register [msgcat::mc "Menu: Open Recent"] menus::launcher
00147 
00148     $mb add cascade -label [msgcat::mc "Open Favorite"] -menu [menu $mb.favorites -tearoff false -postcommand "menus::file_favorites_posting $mb.favorites"]
00149     launcher::register [msgcat::mc "Menu: Open Favorite"] favorites::launcher
00150 
00151     $mb add separator
00152 
00153     $mb add command -label [msgcat::mc "Save"] -underline 0 -command "menus::save_command"
00154     launcher::register [msgcat::mc "Menu: Save file"] menus::save_command
00155 
00156     $mb add command -label [msgcat::mc "Save As..."] -underline 5 -command "menus::save_as_command"
00157     launcher::register [msgcat::mc "Menu: Save file as"] menus::save_as_command
00158 
00159     $mb add command -label [msgcat::mc "Save All"] -underline 6 -command "gui::save_all"
00160     launcher::register [msgcat::mc "Menu: Save all files"] gui::save_all
00161 
00162     $mb add separator
00163 
00164     $mb add command -label [msgcat::mc "Lock"] -underline 0 -command "menus::lock_command $mb"
00165     launcher::register [msgcat::mc "Menu: Lock file"] "menus::lock_command $mb"
00166     launcher::register [msgcat::mc "Menu: Unlock file"] "menus::unlock_command $mb"
00167 
00168     $mb add command -label [msgcat::mc "Favorite"] -underline 0 -command "menus::favorite_command $mb"
00169     launcher::register [msgcat::mc "Menu: Favorite file"] "menus::favorite_command $mb"
00170     launcher::register [msgcat::mc "Menu: Unfavorite file"] "menus::unfavorite_command $mb"
00171 
00172     $mb add separator
00173 
00174     $mb add command -label [msgcat::mc "Close"] -underline 0 -command "menus::close_command"
00175     launcher::register [msgcat::mc "Menu: Close current tab"] menus::close_command
00176 
00177     $mb add command -label [msgcat::mc "Close All"] -underline 6 -command "menus::close_all_command"
00178     launcher::register [msgcat::mc "Menu: Close all tabs"] menus::close_all_command
00179 
00180     # Only add the quit menu to File if we are not running in aqua
00181     if {[tk windowingsystem] ne "aqua"} {
00182       $mb add separator
00183       $mb add command -label [msgcat::mc "Quit"] -underline 0 -command "menus::exit_command"
00184     }
00185     launcher::register [msgcat::mc "Menu: Quit application"] menus::exit_command
00186 
00187   }

00189   ######################################################################
00190   # Called prior to the file menu posting.
00191   proc file_posting {mb} {
00192 
00193     # Get the current file index (if one exists)
00194     if {[set file_index [gui::current_file]] != -1} {
00195 
00196       # Get the current readonly status
00197       set readonly [gui::get_file_info $file_index readonly]
00198 
00199       # Get the current file lock status
00200       set file_lock [expr $readonly || [gui::get_file_info [gui::current_file] lock]]
00201 
00202       # Get the current favorite status
00203       set favorite [favorites::is_favorite [gui::get_file_info $file_index fname]]
00204 
00205       # Configure the Lock/Unlock menu item
00206       if {$file_lock && ![catch "$mb index Lock" index]} {
00207         $mb entryconfigure $index -label [msgcat::mc "Unlock"] -state normal -command "menus::unlock_command $mb"
00208         if {$readonly} {
00209           $mb entryconfigure $index -state disabled
00210         }
00211       } elseif {!$file_lock && ![catch "$mb index Unlock" index]} {
00212         $mb entryconfigure $index -label [msgcat::mc "Lock"] -state normal -command "menus::lock_command $mb"
00213       }
00214 
00215       # Configure the Favorite/Unfavorite menu item
00216       if {$favorite && ![catch "$mb index Favorite" index]} {
00217         $mb entryconfigure $index -label [msgcat::mc "Unfavorite"] -state normal -command "menus::unfavorite_command $mb"
00218       } elseif {!$favorite && ![catch "$mb index Unfavorite" index]} {
00219         $mb entryconfigure $index -label [msgcat::mc "Favorite"] -state normal -command "menus::favorite_command $mb"
00220       }
00221 
00222       # Make sure that the file-specific items are enabled
00223       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Save"]       -state normal
00224       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Save As..."] -state normal
00225       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Save All"]   -state normal
00226       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Close"]      -state normal
00227       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Close All"]  -state normal
00228 
00229     } else {
00230 
00231       # Disable file menu items associated with current tab (since one doesn't currently exist)
00232       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Save"]       -state disabled
00233       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Save As..."] -state disabled
00234       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Save All"]   -state disabled
00235       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Lock"]       -state disabled
00236       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Favorite"]   -state disabled
00237       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Close"]      -state disabled
00238       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Close All"]  -state disabled
00239 
00240     }
00241 
00242     # Configure the Open Recent menu
00243     if {($preferences::prefs(View/ShowRecentlyOpened) == 0) || ([llength [gui::get_last_opened]] == 0)} {
00244       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Open Recent"] -state disabled
00245     } else {
00246       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Open Recent"] -state normal
00247     }
00248 
00249     # Configure the Open Favorite menu
00250     if {[llength [favorites::get_list]] == 0} {
00251       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Open Favorite"] -state disabled
00252     } else {
00253       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Open Favorite"] -state normal
00254     }
00255 
00256   }

00258   ######################################################################
00259   # Sets up the "Open Recent" menu prior to it being posted.
00260   proc file_recent_posting {mb} {
00261 
00262     # Clear the menu
00263     $mb delete 0 end
00264 
00265     # Populate the menu with the filenames and a "Clear All" menu option
00266     foreach fname [lrange [gui::get_last_opened] 0 [expr $preferences::prefs(View/ShowRecentlyOpened) - 1]] {
00267       $mb add command -label [file tail $fname] -command "gui::add_file end $fname"
00268     }
00269     $mb add separator
00270     $mb add command -label [msgcat::mc "Clear All"] -command "gui::clear_last_opened"
00271 
00272   }

00274   ######################################################################
00275   # Updates the "Open Favorite" menu prior to it being posted.
00276   proc file_favorites_posting {mb} {
00277 
00278     # Clear the menu
00279     $mb delete 0 end
00280 
00281     # Populate the menu with the filenames from the favorite list
00282     foreach path [favorites::get_list] {
00283       if {[file isdirectory $path]} {
00284         $mb add command -label $path -command "sidebar::add_directory $path"
00285       } else {
00286         $mb add command -label $path -command "gui::add_file end $path"
00287       }
00288     }
00289 
00290   }

00300   ######################################################################
00301   # Opens a new file and adds a new tab for the file.
00302   proc open_command {} {
00303 
00304     # Get the directory of the current file
00305     set dirname [file dirname [gui::current_filename]]
00306 
00307     if {[set ofiles [tk_getOpenFile -parent . -initialdir $dirname -filetypes [syntax::get_filetypes] -defaultextension .tcl -multiple 1]] ne ""} {
00308       foreach ofile $ofiles {
00309         gui::add_file end $ofile
00310       }
00311     }
00312 
00313   }
00314 
00315   ######################################################################
00316   # Opens a directory in the sidebar.
00317   proc open_dir_command {} {
00318 
00319     # Get the directory of the current file
00320     set dirname [file dirname [gui::current_filename]]
00321 
00322     if {[set odir [tk_chooseDirectory -parent . -initialdir $dirname -mustexist 1]] ne ""} {
00323       sidebar::add_directory $odir
00324     }
00325 
00326   }
00327 
00328   ######################################################################
00329   # Saves the current tab file.
00330   proc save_command {} {
00331 
00332     if {[set sfile [gui::current_filename]] eq ""} {
00333       save_as_command
00334     } else {
00335       gui::save_current {} $sfile
00336     }
00337 
00338   }
00339 
00340   ######################################################################
00341   # Saves the current tab file as a new filename.
00342   proc save_as_command {} {
00343 
00344     # Get the directory of the current file
00345     set dirname [file dirname [gui::current_filename]]
00346 
00347     # Get some of the save options
00348     set save_opts [list]
00349     if {[llength [set extensions [syntax::get_extensions {}]]] > 0} {
00350       lappend save_opts -defaultextension [lindex $extensions 0]
00351     }
00352 
00353     if {[set sfile [tk_getSaveFile {*}$save_opts -title [msgcat::mc "Save As"] -parent . -initialdir $dirname]] ne ""} {
00354       gui::save_current {} $sfile
00355     }
00356 
00357   }

00359   ######################################################################
00360   # Locks the current file.
00361   proc lock_command {mb} {
00362 
00363     # Lock the current file
00364     if {[gui::set_current_file_lock {} 1]} {
00365 
00366       # Set the menu up to display the unlock file menu option
00367       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Lock"] -label [msgcat::mc "Unlock"] -command "menus::unlock_command $mb"
00368 
00369     }
00370 
00371   }

00373   ######################################################################
00374   # Unlocks the current file.
00375   proc unlock_command {mb} {
00376 
00377     # Unlock the current file
00378     if {[gui::set_current_file_lock {} 0]} {
00379 
00380       # Set the menu up to display the lock file menu option
00381       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Unlock"] -label [msgcat::mc "Lock"] -command "menus::lock_command $mb"
00382 
00383     }
00384 
00385   }

00387   ######################################################################
00388   # Marks the current file as a favorite.
00389   proc favorite_command {mb} {
00390 
00391     # Get the current file index (if one exists)
00392     if {[set file_index [gui::current_file]] != -1} {
00393 
00394       # Add the file as a favorite
00395       if {[favorites::add [gui::get_file_info $file_index fname]]} {
00396 
00397         # Set the menu up to display the unfavorite file menu option
00398         $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Favorite"] -label [msgcat::mc "Unfavorite"] -command "menus::unfavorite_command $mb"
00399 
00400       }
00401 
00402     }
00403 
00404   }
00405 
00406   ######################################################################
00407   # Marks the current file as not favorited.
00408   proc unfavorite_command {mb} {
00409 
00410     # Get the current file index (if one exists)
00411     if {[set file_index [gui::current_file]] != -1} {
00412 
00413       # Remove the file as a favorite
00414       if {[favorites::remove [gui::get_file_info $file_index fname]]} {
00415 
00416         $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Unfavorite"] -label [msgcat::mc "Favorite"] -command "menus::favorite_command $mb"
00417 
00418       }
00419 
00420     }
00421 
00422   }

00440   ######################################################################
00441   # Exits the application.
00442   proc exit_command {} {
00443 
00444     # Close any open buffers
00445     # gui::close_buffers
00446 
00447     # Save the session information if we are not told to exit on close
00448     if {!$::cl_exit_on_close} {
00449       gui::save_session
00450     }
00451 
00452     # Close all of the tabs
00453     gui::close_all 1
00454 
00455     # Save the clipboard history
00456     cliphist::save
00457 
00458     # Handle on_quit plugins
00459     plugins::handle_on_quit
00460 
00461     # Turn off profiling (if it was turned on)
00462     if {[::tke_development]} {
00463       stop_profiling_command .menubar.tools 0
00464     }
00465 
00466     # Destroy the interface
00467     destroy .
00468 
00469   }

00559   ######################################################################
00560   # Called just prior to posting the edit menu.  Sets the state of all
00561   # menu items to match the proper state of the UI.
00562   proc edit_posting {mb} {
00563 
00564     if {[gui::current_txt {}] eq ""} {
00565       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Undo"]             -state disabled
00566       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Redo"]             -state disabled
00567       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Cut"]              -state disabled
00568       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Copy"]             -state disabled
00569       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Paste"]            -state disabled
00570       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Paste and Format"] -state disabled
00571       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Select All"]       -state disabled
00572       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Insert Text"]      -state disabled
00573       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Format Text"]      -state disabled
00574     } else {
00575       if {[gui::undoable]} {
00576         $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Undo"] -state normal
00577       } else {
00578         $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Undo"] -state disabled
00579       }
00580       if {[gui::redoable {}]} {
00581         $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Redo"] -state normal
00582       } else {
00583         $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Redo"] -state disabled
00584       }
00585       if {[gui::selected {}]} {
00586         $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Cut"]  -state normal
00587         $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Copy"] -state normal
00588       } else {
00589         $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Cut"]  -state disabled
00590         $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Copy"] -state disabled
00591       }
00592       if {[gui::pastable {}]} {
00593         $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Paste"]            -state normal
00594         $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Paste and Format"] -state normal
00595       } else {
00596         $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Paste"]            -state disabled
00597         $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Paste and Format"] -state disabled
00598       }
00599       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Select All"]  -state normal
00600       if {[gui::editable {}]} {
00601         $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Insert Text"] -state normal
00602       } else {
00603         $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Insert Text"] -state disabled
00604       }
00605       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Format Text"] -state normal
00606     }
00607 
00608   }

00697   # Called just prior to posting the find menu.  Sets the state of the menu
00698   # items to match the current UI state.
00699   proc find_posting {mb} {
00700 
00701     if {[set txt [gui::current_txt {}]] eq ""} {
00702       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Find"]                       -state disabled
00703       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Find and Replace"]           -state disabled
00704       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Select next occurrence"]     -state disabled
00705       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Select previous occurrence"] -state disabled
00706       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Append next occurrence"]     -state disabled
00707       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Select all occurrences"]     -state disabled
00708       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Find marker"]                -state disabled
00709       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Find matching pair"]         -state disabled
00710     } else {
00711       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Find"]                       -state normal
00712       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Find and Replace"]           -state normal
00713       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Select next occurrence"]     -state normal
00714       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Select previous occurrence"] -state normal
00715       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Append next occurrence"]     -state normal
00716       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Select all occurrences"]     -state normal
00717       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Find matching pair"]         -state normal
00718       if {[llength [gui::get_marker_list {}]] > 0} {
00719         $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Find marker"] -state normal
00720       } else {
00721         $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Find marker"] -state disabled
00722       }
00723     }
00724 
00725   }

00740   ######################################################################
00741   # Performs an egrep-like search in a user-specified list of files/directories.
00742   proc find_in_files {} {
00743 
00744     set rsp_list [list]
00745 
00746     # Display the find UI to the user and get input
00747     if {[gui::fif_get_input rsp_list]} {
00748 
00749       array set rsp $rsp_list
00750 
00751       # Convert directories into files
00752       array set files {}
00753       foreach file $rsp(in) {
00754         if {[file isdirectory $file]} {
00755           foreach sfile [glob -nocomplain -directory $file -types {f r} *] {
00756             if {![sidebar::ignore_file $sfile]} {
00757               set files($sfile) 1
00758             }
00759           }
00760         } elseif {![sidebar::ignore_file $file]} {
00761           set files($file) 1
00762         }
00763       }
00764 
00765       # Perform egrep operation (test)
00766       if {[array size files] > 0} {
00767         bgproc::system find_in_files "egrep -a -H -C$preferences::prefs(Find/ContextNum) -n $rsp(egrep_opts) -s {$rsp(find)} [lsort [array names files]]" -killable 1 \
00768           -callback "menus::find_in_files_callback [list $rsp(find)] [array size files]"
00769       } else {
00770         gui::set_info_message "No files found in specified directories"
00771       }
00772 
00773     }
00774 
00775   }
00776 
00777   ######################################################################
00778   # Called when the egrep operation has completed.
00779   proc find_in_files_callback {find_expr num_files err data} {
00780 
00781     variable txt_cursor
00782 
00783     # Add the file to the viewer
00784     gui::add_file end Results -sidebar 0 -buffer 1
00785 
00786     # Add bindings to allow one-click file opening
00787     set txt [gui::current_txt {}]
00788 
00789     # Get the last index of the text widget
00790     set last_line [$txt index end]
00791 
00792     # Insert a starting mark
00793     $txt insert end "----\n"
00794 
00795     if {!$err || ($num_files == 0)} {
00796 
00797       # Save the text cursor
00798       set txt_cursor [$txt cget -cursor]
00799 
00800       # Append the results to the text widget
00801       $txt insert end [find_in_files_format $data]
00802 
00803       # Highlight and bind the matches
00804       $txt tag configure fif -underline 1 -borderwidth 1 -relief raised -foreground black -background yellow
00805       set i 0
00806       foreach index [$txt search -regexp -all -count find_counts -- $find_expr $last_line] {
00807         $txt tag add fif $index "$index + [lindex $find_counts $i]c"
00808         $txt tag bind fif <Enter>           { %W configure -cursor hand2 }
00809         $txt tag bind fif <Leave>           { %W configure -cursor $menus::txt_cursor }
00810         $txt tag bind fif <ButtonRelease-1> { menus::find_in_files_handle_click %W %x %y }
00811         incr i
00812       }
00813 
00814       bind $txt <Key-space> { if {[menus::find_in_files_handle_space %W]} break }
00815 
00816     } else {
00817 
00818       $txt insert end "ERROR: $data\n\n\n"
00819 
00820     }
00821 
00822     # Adjust the Vim insert cursor
00823     vim::adjust_insert $txt.t
00824 
00825     # Make sure that the beginning of the inserted text is in view
00826     $txt see end
00827     $txt mark set insert $last_line
00828     $txt see $last_line
00829 
00830   }
00831 
00832   ######################################################################
00833   # Formats the raw egrep data to make it more readable.
00834   proc find_in_files_format {data} {
00835 
00836     set results         ""
00837     set file_results    [list]
00838     set last_linenum    ""
00839     set first_separator 1
00840     array set indices   {}
00841     array set fnames    {}
00842     set index           0
00843     set matches         0
00844 
00845     foreach line [split $data \n] {
00846       if {[regexp {^(.*?)([:-])(\d+)[:-](.*)$} $line -> fname type linenum content]} {
00847         set first_separator 1
00848         if {![info exists fnames($fname)]} {
00849           set fnames($fname) 1
00850           if {[llength $file_results] > 0} {
00851             if {[string trim [lindex $file_results end]] eq "..."} {
00852               set file_results [lrange $file_results 0 end-1]
00853             }
00854             append results "[join $file_results \n]\n\n"
00855             set file_results [list]
00856           }
00857           lappend file_results "  [file normalize $fname]:\n"
00858           set last_linenum ""
00859           array unset indices
00860         }
00861         if {$type eq ":"} {
00862           if {($last_linenum eq "") || ($linenum > $last_linenum)} {
00863             lappend file_results [format "    %6d: %s" $linenum $content]
00864             set indices($linenum) $index
00865             set last_linenum $linenum
00866             incr index
00867           } else {
00868             lset file_results $indices($linenum) [string replace [lindex $file_results $indices($linenum)] 11 11 ":"]
00869           }
00870           incr matches
00871         } else {
00872           if {($last_linenum eq "") || ($linenum > $last_linenum)} {
00873             lappend file_results [format "    %6d  %s" $linenum $content]
00874             set indices($linenum) $index
00875             set last_linenum $linenum
00876             incr index
00877           }
00878         }
00879       } elseif {[string trim $line] eq "--"} {
00880         if {$first_separator} {
00881           set first_separator 0
00882         } else {
00883           lappend file_results "    ..."
00884         }
00885       }
00886     }
00887 
00888     # Append the last files information to the results string
00889     append results "[join $file_results \n]\n\n"
00890 
00891     return "Found $matches [expr {($matches != 1) ? {matches} : {match}}] in [array size fnames] [expr {([array size fnames] != 1) ? {files} : {file}}]\n\n$results"
00892 
00893   }
00894 
00895   ######################################################################
00896   # Handles a left-click on a matched pattern in the given text widget.
00897   # Causes the matching file to be opened and we jump to the matching line.
00898   proc find_in_files_handle_selection {W index} {
00899 
00900     # Get the line number from the beginning of the line
00901     regexp {^\s*(\d+)} [$W get "$index linestart" $index] -> linenum
00902 
00903     # Get the filename of the line that is clicked
00904     set findex [$W search -regexp -backwards -count fif_count -- {^\s*/.*:$} $index]
00905     set fname  [$W get $findex "$findex+[expr $fif_count - 1]c"]
00906 
00907     # Add the file to the file viewer (if necessary)
00908     gui::add_file end [string trim $fname]
00909 
00910     # Jump to the line and set the cursor to the beginning of the line
00911     set txt [gui::current_txt {}]
00912     $txt see $linenum.0
00913     $txt mark set insert $linenum.0
00914 
00915   }
00916 
00917   ######################################################################
00918   # Handles a left-click on a matched pattern in the given text widget.
00919   proc find_in_files_handle_click {W x y} {
00920 
00921     find_in_files_handle_selection $W [$W index @$x,$y]
00922 
00923   }
00924 
00925   ######################################################################
00926   # Handles a space bar key hit on a matched pattern in the given text
00927   # widget.
00928   proc find_in_files_handle_space {W} {
00929 
00930     # Get the current insertion index
00931     set insert [$W index insert]
00932 
00933     # Check to see if the space bar was hit inside of a tag
00934     foreach {first last} [$W tag ranges fif] {
00935       if {[$W compare $first <= $insert] && [$W compare $insert < $last]} {
00936         find_in_files_handle_selection $W [$W index insert]
00937         return 1
00938       }
00939     }
00940 
00941     return 0
00942 
00943   }
00944

00994     }

00998   ######################################################################

01008     launcher::register [msgcat::mc "Menu: Hide sidebar"] "menus::hide_sidebar_view $mb"

01023       $mb add command -label [msgcat::mc "Show Tab Bar"] -underline 5 -command "menus::show_tab_view $mb"

01032     }

01034     launcher::register [msgcat::mc "Menu: Hide status bar"] "menus::hide_status_view $mb"

01073   ######################################################################
01074   # Called just prior to posting the view menu.  Sets the state of the
01075   # menu options to match the current UI state.
01076   proc view_posting {mb} {
01077 
01078     variable show_split_pane
01079 
01080     if {([gui::tabs_in_pane] < 2) && ([gui::panes] < 2)} {
01081       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Tabs"] -state disabled
01082     } else {
01083       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Tabs"] -state normal
01084     }
01085 
01086     if {[gui::current_txt {}] eq ""} {
01087       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Split view"]         -state disabled
01088       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Move to other pane"] -state disabled
01089       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Set Syntax"]         -state disabled
01090     } else {
01091       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Split view"]         -state normal
01092       if {[gui::movable_to_other_pane]} {
01093         $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Move to other pane"] -state normal
01094       } else {
01095         $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Move to other pane"] -state disabled
01096       }
01097       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Set Syntax"]         -state normal
01098       set show_split_pane [expr {[llength [[gui::current_txt {}] peer names]] > 0}]
01099     }
01100 
01101   }
01102 
01103   ######################################################################
01104   # Called just prior to posting the view/tabs menu.  Sets the state of
01105   # the menu options to match the current UI state.
01106   proc view_tabs_posting {mb} {
01107 
01108     if {[gui::tabs_in_pane] < 2} {
01109       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Goto Next Tab"]     -state disabled
01110       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Goto Previous Tab"] -state disabled
01111       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Goto Last Tab"]     -state disabled
01112       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Sort Tabs"]         -state disabled
01113     } else {
01114       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Goto Next Tab"]     -state normal
01115       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Goto Previous Tab"] -state normal
01116       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Goto Last Tab"]     -state normal
01117       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Sort Tabs"]         -state normal
01118     }
01119 
01120     if {[gui::panes] < 2} {
01121       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Goto Other Pane"] -state disabled
01122     } else {
01123       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Goto Other Pane"] -state normal
01124     }
01125 
01126   }

01310

01312       themer::import_tm $name syntax::load_themes

01318   ######################################################################
01319   # Starts the procedure profiling.
01320   proc start_profiling_command {mb} {
01321 
01322     if {[$mb entrycget [msgcat::mc "Start Profiling"] -state] eq "normal"} {
01323 
01324       # Turn on procedure profiling
01325       profile {*}$preferences::prefs(Tools/ProfileReportOptions) on
01326 
01327       # Indicate that profiling mode is on
01328       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Start Profiling"] -state disabled
01329       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Stop Profiling"]  -state normal
01330 
01331       # Indicate that profiling has started in the information bar
01332       gui::set_info_message [msgcat::mc "Profiling started"]
01333 
01334     }
01335 
01336   }
01337 
01338   ######################################################################
01339   # Stops the profiling process, generates a report and displays the
01340   # report file to a new editor tab.
01341   proc stop_profiling_command {mb show_report} {
01342 
01343     variable profile_report
01344     variable profiling_info
01345 
01346     if {[$mb entrycget [msgcat::mc "Stop Profiling"] -state] eq "normal"} {
01347 
01348       # Turn off procedure profiling
01349       profile off profiling_info
01350 
01351       # Generate a report file
01352       generate_profile_report
01353       # set sortby $preferences::prefs(Tools/ProfileReportSortby)
01354       # profrep profiling_info $sortby $profile_report "Profiling Information Sorted by $sortby"
01355 
01356       # Indicate that profiling has completed
01357       gui::set_info_message [msgcat::mc "Profiling stopped"]
01358 
01359       # Add the report to the tab list
01360       if {$show_report} {
01361         show_last_profiling_report
01362       }
01363 
01364       # Indicate that profiling mode is off
01365       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Stop Profiling"] -state disabled
01366       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Start Profiling"] -state normal
01367 
01368     }
01369 
01370   }
01371 
01372   ######################################################################
01373   # Displays the last profiling report.
01374   proc show_last_profiling_report {} {
01375 
01376     variable profile_report
01377 
01378     # If the profiling report exists, display it
01379     if {[file exists $profile_report]} {
01380       gui::add_file end $profile_report -lock 1
01381     }
01382 
01383   }
01384 
01385   ######################################################################
01386   # Generates a profiling report.
01387   proc generate_profile_report {} {
01388 
01389     variable profile_report
01390     variable profiling_info
01391 
01392     # Recollect the data
01393     set info_list [list]
01394     foreach info [array names profiling_info] {
01395 
01396       set name [lindex $info 0]
01397 
01398       # If the name matches anything that we don't want to profile,
01399       # skip to the next iteration now
01400       if {[regexp {^(((::)?(tk::|tcl::|ttk::|tablelist::|mwutil::))|<global>|::\w+$)} $name]} {
01401         continue
01402       }
01403 
01404       set calls [lindex $profiling_info($info) 0]
01405       set real  [lindex $profiling_info($info) 1]
01406       set cpu   [lindex $profiling_info($info) 2]
01407 
01408       if {[set index [lsearch -index 0 $info_list [lindex $info 0]]] == -1} {
01409         lappend info_list [list [lindex $info 0] $calls $real $cpu 0.0 0.0]
01410       } else {
01411         set info_entry [lindex $info_list $index]
01412         lset info_list $index 1 [expr [lindex $info_entry 1] + $calls]
01413         lset info_list $index 2 [expr [lindex $info_entry 2] + $real]
01414         lset info_list $index 3 [expr [lindex $info_entry 3] + $cpu]
01415       }
01416 
01417     }
01418 
01419     # Calculate the real/call and cpu/call values
01420     for {set i 0} {$i < [llength $info_list]} {incr i} {
01421       set info_entry [lindex $info_list $i]
01422       if {[lindex $info_entry 1] > 0} {
01423         lset info_list $i 4 [expr [lindex $info_entry 2].0 / [lindex $info_entry 1]]
01424         lset info_list $i 5 [expr [lindex $info_entry 3].0 / [lindex $info_entry 1]]
01425       }
01426     }
01427 
01428     # Sort the information
01429     switch $preferences::prefs(Tools/ProfileReportSortby) {
01430       "calls"         { set info_list [lsort -decreasing -integer -index 1 $info_list] }
01431       "real"          { set info_list [lsort -decreasing -integer -index 2 $info_list] }
01432       "cpu"           { set info_list [lsort -decreasing -integer -index 3 $info_list] }
01433       "real_per_call" { set info_list [lsort -decreasing -real -index 4 $info_list] }
01434       "cpu_per_call"  { set info_list [lsort -decreasing -real -index 5 $info_list] }
01435       default         { set info_list [lsort -index 0 $info_list] }
01436     }
01437 
01438     # Create the report file
01439     if {![catch "open $profile_report w" rc]} {
01440 
01441       puts $rc "=============================================================================================================="
01442       puts $rc [msgcat::mc "                                  Profiling Report Sorted By (%s)" $preferences::prefs(Tools/ProfileReportSortby)]
01443       puts $rc "=============================================================================================================="
01444       puts $rc [format "%-50s  %10s  %10s  %10s  %10s  %10s" "Procedure" "Calls" "Real" "CPU" "Real/Calls" "CPU/Calls"]
01445       puts $rc "=============================================================================================================="
01446 
01447       foreach info $info_list {
01448         puts $rc [format "%-50s  %10d  %10d  %10d  %10.3f  %10.3f" {*}$info]
01449       }
01450 
01451       close $rc
01452 
01453     }
01454 
01455   }

01459   proc restart_command {} {
01460 
01461     # Get the list of filenames to start
01462     set filenames [gui::get_actual_filenames]
01463 
01464     # Execute the restart command
01465     exec [info nameofexecutable] [file join $::tke_dir restart.tcl] [info nameofexecutable] [file join $::tke_dir tke.tcl] {*}$filenames &
01466 
01467   }

01498   proc add_help {mb} {
01499

01501     launcher::register [msgcat::mc "Menu: View User Guide"] [list utils::open_file_externally [file join $::tke_dir doc UserGuide.pdf]]
01502 
01503     if {![string match *Win* $::tcl_platform(os)]} {
01504       if {[preferences::get General/UpdateReleaseType] eq "devel"} {
01505         set check_cmd "specl::check_for_update 0 [expr $specl::RTYPE_STABLE | $specl::RTYPE_DEVEL]"
01506       } else {
01507         set check_cmd "specl::check_for_update 0 $specl::RTYPE_STABLE"
01508       }
01509       $mb add separator
01510       $mb add command -label [msgcat::mc "Check for Update"] -underline 0 -command $check_cmd
01511       launcher::register [msgcat::mc "Menu: Check for Update"] $check_cmd
01512     }
01513       
01514     if {[tk windowingsystem] ne "aqua"} {
01515       $mb add separator
01516       $mb add command -label [msgcat::mc "About TKE"] -underline 0 -command "gui::show_about"
01517       launcher::register [msgcat::mc "Menu: About TKE"] "gui::show_about"
01518     }

01522   ######################################################################
01523   # Displays the launcher with recently opened files.
01524   proc launcher {} {
01525 
01526     # Add favorites to launcher
01527     foreach fname [lrange [gui::get_last_opened] 0 [expr $preferences::prefs(View/ShowRecentlyOpened) - 1]] {
01528       launcher::register_temp "`RECENT:$fname" [list gui::add_file end $fname] $fname
01529     }
01530 
01531     # Display the launcher in RECENT: mode
01532     launcher::launch "`RECENT:"
01533 
01534     # Unregister the recents
01535     foreach fname [lrange [gui::get_last_opened] 0 [expr $preferences::prefs(View/ShowRecentlyOpened) - 1]] {
01536       launcher::unregister "`RECENT:$fname"
01537     }
01538 
01539   }
